posts_data.title: Marghöfða dýrið - Djöfladýrkun undir jökli
posts_data.content:
SURPRISE! We slid this one into the schedule unannounced, and it wouldn't be the first time we've done so with some of our favourite Icelandic musicians...

Here's what we can tell you about this project...

Marghöfða dýrið (The multi-headed beast) is taken from a 17th century curse lamenting the coming of the antichrist. The beast is spearheaded by T. alongside various session musicians at any given time. The demo EP Djöfladýrkun undir jökli (Devil Worship under the Glacier) is its first official release, coming out on LP and MC through Goatowarex and Vánagandr respectively, satirising Laxnes' novel Kristnihald undir jökli. The lyrics twist and mock the legacy of Protestant Christianity in Iceland from its hostile takeover of Catholic heresy in Skálholt during the middle of the 16th century into the godless, impure age of modernity. 

The project wears its musical influences on its sleeve, paying tribute to the black metal of old without shame, citing the likes of Ildjarn and Darkthrone (among others) in its compositional approach as well as taking inspiration from old Nordic folk music and childhood memories. This is only the first of the Hydra's heads, Babylon's consort!

posts_data.title: Q&A: Dylan Walker of Full of Hell
posts_data.content: Set to be (one of) our Artists In Residence in 2020, Full Of Hell are a band that embody the spirit of Roadburn. Marika Zorzi catches up with Dylan Walker to find out what the band have been up to instead of taking up residence in Tilburg, and what the future holds for this most exciting of heavy bands. Leave your questions in the comments below if you’re watching live.

posts_data.title: Paradox Presents: Autarkh III
posts_data.content:
If yesterday’s live performance of Form In Motion has got you eager for more from this homegrown Tilburg band, then we have you covered - but be prepared for a change of gear… Autarkh III is a reimagining of Form In Motion - an alternate timeline if you like. Focussing on ambient and drone atmospheres, alternating with sections that are leaning more towards improvisation and heavier down-tempo arrangements, this is Autarkh but not as you know them.

Can't get enough Autarkh? Click HERE.

posts_data.title: Dawn Ray'd
posts_data.content:
Featuring two versions of the same song, constructed with alternative compositions and evoking different atmospheres, this exclusive video recording showcases the many facets of Dawn Ray’d. Titled Wild Fire I and Wild Fire II - embrace both the black metal and the folk elements of Dawn Ray’d. These tracks are unreleased and exclusive to Roadburn Redux -  but keep your eyes peeled for more info on them soon.

Click here for all things Dawn Ray’d.

posts_data.title: Enjoying the show?
posts_data.content:
Wow! Solar Temple are... something else!


We really hope you're enjoying the shows beamed into your homes live from the 013 venue in Tilburg. If you're willing/able to make a donation towards the cost of putting these shows on, we'd be so grateful! Of course, it's not necessary to do so to be part of the Roadburn experience, but donations will go a long way to covering the cost of creating these immersive experiences.

This has been a wild ride of a weekend so far - let us know in the comments what your highlights are up til now.

Don't forget, The Pit Stop is open if you want to hang face to face with your fellow Roadburners!


Enjoy!
